scikit-fem¶

This package contains finite element assemblers. They transform bilinear and linear forms into sparse matrices and vectors.

Mesh module¶

Mesh module contains different types of finite element meshes.

Currently implemented mesh types are

  • skfem.mesh.MeshTri, a triangular mesh
  • skfem.mesh.MeshTet, a tetrahedral mesh
  • skfem.mesh.MeshQuad, a mesh consisting of quadrilaterals
  • skfem.mesh.MeshLine, one-dimensional mesh
  • skfem.mesh.MeshLineMortar, interface mesh between two 2D meshes

Examples¶

Obtain a three times refined mesh of the unit square and draw it.

from skfem.mesh import MeshTri
m = MeshTri()
for itr in range(3):
    m.refine()
m.draw()
m.show()

Assembly module¶

Assemblers transform bilinear forms into sparse matrices and linear forms into vectors. Moreover, they are used for computing local functionals over elements and for assigning DOF’s to different topological entities of the mesh.

There are currently two major assembler types. skfem.assembly.AssemblerLocal uses finite elements defined through reference element. skfem.assembly.AssemblerGlobal uses finite elements defined through DOF functionals. The latter are more general but slower.

Examples¶

Assemble the stiffness matrix related to the Poisson problem using the piecewise linear elements.

from skfem.mesh import MeshTri
from skfem.assembly import AssemblerLocal
from skfem.element import ElementLocalTriP1

m = MeshTri()
for itr in range(3):
    m.refine()
e = ElementLocalTriP1()
a = AssemblerLocal(m, e)

def bilinear_form(du, dv):
    return du[0]*dv[0] + du[1]*dv[1]

K = a.iasm(bilinear_form)

Element module¶

Element classes define the finite element basis functions or DOF functionals.

The two major types of elements are subclasses of
  • skfem.element.ElementLocal
  • skfem.element.ElementGlobal

The former are used together with skfem.assembly.AssemblerLocal and the latter with skfem.assembly.AssemblerGlobal.

Moreover, the name of the element class reveals which types of meshes it is designed for.

What follows is a list of currently supported elements. Note that new elements are fairly easy to add yourself.

ElementGlobalTriDG(elem) Transform all dofs into interior dofs.
ElementGlobalTriP0() Piecewise constant triangles.
ElementGlobalLineP1() Piecewise linear element in 1D.
ElementGlobalLineHermite() C^1 continuous Hermite element for Euler-Bernoulli beam.
ElementGlobalTriPp([p]) Triangular Pp element, Lagrange DOFs.
ElementGlobalMorley Morley element for fourth-order problems.
ElementGlobalArgyris Argyris element for fourth-order problems.
ElementTetRT0 Lowest order Raviart-Thomas element for tetrahedron.
ElementTriRT0 Lowest order Raviart-Thomas element for triangle.
ElementLocalH1Vec(elem) Convert \(H^1\) element to vectorial \(H^1\) element.
ElementLocalQ1 Simplest quadrilateral element.
ElementLocalQ2 Second order quadrilateral element.
ElementLocalTriDG(elem) Transform a H1 conforming triangular element into a discontinuous one by turning all DOFs into interior DOFs.
ElementLocalTetDG(elem) Convert a H1 tetrahedral element into a DG element.
ElementLocalTetP0 Piecewise constant element for tetrahedral mesh.
ElementLocalTriP0 Piecewise constant element for triangular mesh.
ElementLocalTriMini The MINI-element for triangular mesh.
ElementLocalTetP2 The quadratic tetrahedral element.
ElementLocalLineP2 Quadratic element for one dimension.
ElementLocalLineP1 Linear element for one dimension.
ElementLocalTriP1 The simplest triangular element.
ElementLocalTriP2 The quadratic triangular element.
ElementLocalTetP1 The simplest tetrahedral element.
